name: Brian Bell
description:
'''Brian Lane Bell''' (born December 9, 1968) is an American musician, singer, and songwriter. He is best known as the rhythm guitarist, keyboardist, backing vocalist, and occasional lead vocalist of the [[Rock music|rock]] band [[Weezer]], with whom he has recorded fifteen studio albums. Bell also fronted the rock band [[The Relationship]] and was the lead vocalist and guitarist of the [[indie rock]] band [[Space Twins]].

Moving to Los Angeles at the age of eighteen, Bell played [[bass guitar]] in the band [[Carnival Art]], releasing three studio albums with the band before departing in 1993. Bell subsequently joined Weezer as its rhythm guitarist and backing vocalist, at the request of band member [[Matt Sharp]]. Replacing founding member [[Jason Cropper]], Bell joined the band during the recording of its debut album, ''[[Weezer (Blue Album)|Weezer]]'' (1994). Backed by the singles "[[Buddy Holly (song)|Buddy Holly]]", "[[Undone â€“ The Sweater Song]]" and "[[Say It Ain't So]]", the album was a critical and commercial success.
